channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Health Canada ignored expert advice to expand access to safe drugs for opioid users, internal documents show
item.description: As deadly drug overdoses climbed across Canada, decision-makers faced political backlash for funding programs that gave drug users prescribed opioids and, against their own experts’ advice, scaled back their support of safe supply programs, an investigation by CBC’s the fifth estate has found.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Montrealers who depend on public transit brace for STM strike this weekend
item.description: The decision, handed down late Wednesday, is said to be a major disappointment for those caring for the vulnerable population.

item.title: ‘Heartbreaking tragedy': Ontario towns grieve loss of 3 teens killed in crash
item.description: Mayor Kevin Eccles says the rural communities of Hanover and West Grey are grieving deeply after a crash killed three teens and left another critically injured.

item.title: Filipino community close to getting Vancouver cultural centre, but not everyone agrees
item.description: 'Perhaps if we had a home, things might have been a little bit different in this healing process,' Warren Dean Flandez with the Filipino Legacy Society told Global News.

item.title: Saskatchewan farming group raises concerns over foreign land ownership
item.description: Saskatchewan's largest farmers group is calling on the government to consider their concerns regarding foreign farm land ownership.

item.title: Alberta premier supportive of new major projects, says pipeline negotiation ongoing
item.description: Not amongst the second batch of key major projects was a bitumen pipeline Alberta has been advocating for, but Danielle Smith says negotiations with Ottawa are ongoing.

item.title: Quebec men accused in alleged extremist plot will go to trial following federal indictment
item.description: Three Quebec men accused of facilitating terrorism will be sent to trial after the federal Crown prosecutor’s office filed a direct indictment on Nov. 7, along with new charges.

item.title: How to Speed Up Wheelchair Repairs
item.description: Systemic changes are needed from government and industry, experts say. In the meantime, users are turning to DIY.

item.title: Calgary city councillors, mayor to introduce motion to repeal citywide rezoning
item.description: The motion calls on city administration to revert the Calgary's land-use bylaw to what it was prior to the previous city council approving citywide rezoning back in 2024.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: N.S. missing kids: Volunteers to focus search on riverbanks for Lilly and Jack
item.description: The renewed search in Pictou County is being led by the Ontario-based not-for-profit group, Bring Me Home. Lilly and Jack have been missing for over six months.
